oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Fate of the false monopoles: Induced vacuum decay
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KUMAR, B
PARANJAPE, MB
YAJNIK, UA
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: supersymmetry breaking

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We study a gauge theory model where there is an intermediate symmetry breaking to a metastable vacuum that breaks a simple gauge group to a U(1) factor. Such a model admits the existence of metastable magnetic monopoles, which we dub false monopoles. We prove the existence of these monopoles in the thin- wall approximation. We determine the instantons for the collective coordinate that corresponds to the radius of the monopole wall and we calculate the semiclassical tunneling rate for the decay of these monopoles. The monopole decay consequently triggers the decay of the false vacuum. As the monopole mass is increased, we find an enhanced rate of decay of the false vacuum relative to the celebrated homogeneous tunneling rate due to S. R. Coleman [Subnuclear series 13, 297 (1977).].
